messages.content: This snap General Election called by the Tories for 8 June is about more than just Brexit. It is about repairing the terrible damage that the Tories and the Liberal Democrats have done to women, children, older and disabled people since 2010. It is about the vindictive and unnecessary austerity imposed on the country by the Tories, ensuring that the poorest suffer the most while the rich get richer. And it doesn’t even work as any economist will tell you.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Labour will reverse this unfairness. We have made 10 pledges to you to rebuild and transform Britain through a fair tax system that will not penalise the majority of workers.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: create a million good quality jobs
build over a million new homes in five years, with at least half a million council homes
cut wealth inequality by not raising taxes on middle and low earners
promote businesses with a National Investment Bank and crack down on late payments
end the public sector pay cap
ban zero hours contracts and unpaid internships
double paid paternity leave to four weeks and increase paternity pay
raise the minimum wage to the level of the living wage (expected to be at least £10 per hour by 2020)

issues.economy: Labour’s Plan to end Britain’s rigged economy. The cornerstone of the next Labour government’s programme is to transform the workplace where many workers experience an economy rigged in favour of the rich, from tax breaks to executive bonuses and where small businesses have suffered. It is a national scandal that six million people earn less than the living wage and four million children are growing up in poverty. A Labour government would bring these outrages to an end.
issues.labourEmployment: End the public sector pay cap, ban zero hours contracts and unpaid internships, double paid paternity leave to four weeks and increase paternity pay, raise the minimum wage to the level of the living wage (expected to be at least £10 per hour by 2020)
issues.socialWelfare: Labour will reverse this unfairness. We have made 10 pledges to you to rebuild and transform Britain through a fair tax system that will not penalise the majority of workers.

examples: build over a million new homes in five years, with at least half a million council homes
raise the minimum wage to the level of the living wage (expected to be at least £10 per hour by 2020)

Labour’s Plan to end Britain’s rigged economy. The cornerstone of the next Labour government’s programme is to transform the workplace where many workers experience an economy rigged in favour of the rich, from tax breaks to executive bonuses and where small businesses have suffered. It is a national scandal that six million people earn less than the living wage and four million children are growing up in poverty. A Labour government would bring these outrages to an end.

This snap General Election called by the Tories for 8 June is about more than just Brexit. It is about repairing the terrible damage that the Tories and the Liberal Democrats have done to women, children, older and disabled people since 2010. It is about the vindictive and unnecessary austerity imposed on the country by the Tories, ensuring that the poorest suffer the most while the rich get richer. And it doesn’t even work as any economist will tell you.
Labour will reverse this unfairness. We have made 10 pledges to you to rebuild and transform Britain through a fair tax system that will not penalise the majority of workers.
create a million good quality jobs
end the public sector pay cap
promote businesses with a National Investment Bank and crack down on late payments

Labour’s Plan to end Britain’s rigged economy. The cornerstone of the next Labour government’s programme is to transform the workplace where many workers experience an economy rigged in favour of the rich, from tax breaks to executive bonuses and where small businesses have suffered. It is a national scandal that six million people earn less than the living wage and four million children are growing up in poverty. A Labour government would bring these outrages to an end.

This snap General Election called by the Tories for 8 June is about more than just Brexit. It is about repairing the terrible damage that the Tories and the Liberal Democrats have done to women, children, older and disabled people since 2010. It is about the vindictive and unnecessary austerity imposed on the country by the Tories, ensuring that the poorest suffer the most while the rich get richer. And it doesn’t even work as any economist will tell you.
